terms.definition: A centralized repository of information, documentation, and resources that helps teams perform jobs, solve problems, and make decisions
Content Management System - a software platform that allows users to create, edit, and manage digital content without technical expertise
Standard Operating Procedure - a detailed, written instruction document that describes how to perform routine tasks or processes consistently
Customer Relationship Management - a system for managing interactions and relationships with customers and potential customers
Isolated pockets of information within an organization that are not shared across departments, creating barriers to collaboration
Key Performance Indicator - measurable values that demonstrate how effectively a company is achieving key business objectives
A software solution designed specifically for creating, organizing, and managing technical documentation and knowledge resources
The systematic process of capturing, organizing, storing, and sharing institutional knowledge and information across an organization
A technical document that provides instructions and guidance on how to use a product, system, or service effectively
A centralized online resource where users can find answers, tutorials, and support documentation for products or services
An automated software program that simulates human conversation to provide instant responses and support to users
A system that tracks and manages changes to documents or code over time, allowing multiple people to collaborate safely
The structural design and organization of content that determines how information is categorized, labeled, and interconnected
Permission settings that control who can view, edit, or manage specific content within a system or platform
A service that allows data to be stored and accessed remotely over the internet rather than on local computer hardware
